item.title: World Hopes Saddam's Capture Will Ease Iraq's Woes (Reuters)
item.description: Reuters - More nations celebrated the capture of Saddam Hussein on Monday but the jubilation was tinged with questions about the way forward in Iraq, and many called on the United States to quickly end its occupation of the country.

item.title: Saddam's Arrest to Sharpen Debate on Iraq Tribunal (Reuters)
item.description: Reuters - Saddam Hussein's capture means he could face a trial by a newly created Iraqi tribunal -- and a possible death penalty.

item.title: Arabs Have Mixed Emotions About Saddam Capture (Reuters)
item.description: Reuters - Arabs greeted the capture of Saddam Hussein with divided emotions Sunday, welcoming the arrest of a dictator yet tinged with regret that a symbol of Arab defiance against the United States was behind bars.

item.title: Palestinians Mark 'Black Day' of Saddam Capture (Reuters)
item.description: Reuters - Disbelief and gloom seized many Palestinians on Sunday at news of Saddam Hussein's capture while Israel, which came under Iraqi Scud missile attack in the 1991 Gulf War, hailed the United States for capturing Saddam.

item.title: German Government Agrees on 2004 Tax Cut (AP)
item.description: AP - German government and opposition leaders agreed early Monday on a Jan. 1 tax cut and labor-market reforms meant to spur Europe's largest economy, Chancellor Gerhard Schroeder said.

item.title: Turkish Cypriot Opposition Wins Most Votes (AP)
item.description: AP - Turkish Cypriot opposition parties won the most votes in parliamentary elections that could shape the future of divided Cyprus, but their mandate was too slim to gain a majority in parliament.

item.title: Report: 3 Africa Nations Ignore Ivory Ban (AP)
item.description: AP - Nearly 9,000 pounds of illegal ivory is on sale in Nigeria, Ivory Coast and Senegal, three countries singled out for failing to regulate a trade that's fueling poaching and threatening the survival of elephants, wildlife advocacy groups said in a new report.

item.title: Assassination Attempt on Musharraf Fails (AP)
item.description: AP - A bomb exploded moments after Pakistani President Gen. Pervez Musharraf's motorcade passed a bridge near the capital Sunday, at least the second attempt on his life since he enraged hard-liners in 2001 by backing the U.S.-led war on terror in Afghanistan. No one was hurt.

item.title: Chavez: Phone Tape Proves Recall a Fraud (AP)
item.description: AP - President Hugo Chavez released a recorded telephone conversation between a prominent political opponent and his son, claiming Sunday that it proved there was fraud during a petition drive for a recall vote on his rule.

item.title: Blair Hopes Saddam Capture Brings Reconciliation (Reuters)
item.description: Reuters - Tony Blair enjoyed one of the best days of a terrible year Sunday -- but there was no American-style euphoria over Saddam Hussein's capture.

item.title: Martin wants Canada to participate in reconstruction of Iraq (Canadian Press)
item.description: Canadian Press - MONTREAL (CP) - It's "very important for the world and for Canada" that the country participate in the reconstruction of Iraq, a project that will likely be accelerated with the capture of Saddam Hussein, Prime Minister Paul Martin said Sunday.

item.title: Aviator Offers Stranded Pilot Some Fuel (AP)
item.description: AP - A British pilot said Friday she has offered fuel to an Australian aviator stranded in Antarctica now that bad weather has forced her to abandon a bid to fly around the world over both poles.
